item.title: Migrating to Zola: A Practical Guide to a Faster Website
item.description: For the longest time, my personal website was a handful of handcrafted HTML files. It was the epitome of simplicity, and for a while, it worked perfectly. But as I added more blog posts to the “Musings” section, a familiar friction emerged: every new post meant duplicating an entire HTML file, carefully replacing the content, and hoping I didn’t break a link. This manual process was not just tedious; it was fragile.
